title: Final Quiz: Building a Static Site on Arweave

options.answer: To provide the world with permanent, immutable storage.
To increase the TPS of Ethereum and Solana.
To bridge Bitcoin to Ethereum.

questions.question: Does websites get special treatment from Arweave gateways?

options.answer: Yes, if you add the correct tags, gateways will deliver the data as website to a browser.
No, you must download all files with BitTorrent.
Yes, Arweave uses Vite to render websites on the gateway.

questions.question: Why would you use a static site generator to build website on Arweave?

options.answer: Arweave gateways can’t render HTML and build-time rendering solves this issue.
You wouldn’t, as the rendering inhibits token allocations.
You woulnd’t, dynamic websites would be better suited, as they’re more flexible..

questions.question: Does Eleventy create Arweave compliant websites out of the box?

options.answer: No, it needs a filter to rewrite relative URLs, so they work with the TXID Arweave websites start with.
Yes, no special configuration required.
No, Eleventy needs advanced compression to fit the page on Arweave.

questions.question: How do you make Eleventy’s relative URLs work on Arweave?

options.answer: {{ post.url | rel }}
rel(post.url)
{{ rel(post.url) }}

questions.question: Do the relative links created by Eleventy break on an update?

options.answer: No, updates always get new TXIDs. Existing versions stay the same.
Yes, when the TXID changes, the links don’t work anymore.
No, gateways always update TXIDs retroactively.

questions.question: Do you need to purchase AR tokens to deploy a website?

options.answer: No, Arweave bundling services subsidize uploads under 100 KiB.
Yes, all uploads are in transactions that cost money to settle onchain.
No, new wallets can submit 5 free transactions.

questions.question: Does Arweave change the content of a TXID after you upload a new version of a file?

options.answer: No, each new upload will get a new TXID.
Yes, it apppends the new version to the old file.
Np, You can’t upload multiple versions of one file.

questions.question: How can you access multiple files with one TXID?

options.answer: A JSON path manifest that maps paths to TXIDs.
Impossible,you need to keep track of the TXIDs of all pages to link them with each other.
An XML manifest that links TXIDs to URLs.

questions.question: Can you change the TXID of an ArNS name?

options.answer: Yes, you can change their target TXIDs.
No, once you set a TXID, they will always point to that.
Yes, they can change 5 times after registration.

questions.question: How many gateways can deliver a website behind an ArNS name?

options.answer: You can access every ArNS name from every gateway.
Only the first 5 gateways that access the ArNS name will deliver the website.
10 gateways will deliver the website

questions.question: Is there a way to access the immutable TXID of a website?

options.answer: Yes, it’s stored in the X-Arns-Resolved-Id header field.
Yes, it’s stored in the Arweave-Txid header field.
No, the TXID is hidden from the client.
